snippet: The $436 million will go to repair dunes, beaches and sea walls in coastal communities that were hammered by the hurricane.
abstract: Federal government agrees to spend additional $436 million to repair dunes, beaches and sea walls in coastal communities in New York that were hammered by Hurricane Sandy; four projects that had previously been authorized but never completely financed will now receive full federal support through the hurricane relief bill.
lead_paragraph: The $436 million will go to repair dunes, beaches and sea walls in coastal communities that were hammered by the hurricane.

headline.seo: U.S. Will Pay Millions More For Hurricane Sandy Repairs in New York
headline.main: U.S. Will Provide Millions More in Storm Aid for New York
headline.print_headline: U.S. Will Pay Millions More In Storm Aid For New York
